entry.def: Drawn is the past participle of draw .

entry.tran: (人或人脸)清瘦的,憔悴的,愁眉苦脸的
entry.def: If someone or their face looks drawn, their face is thin and they look very tired, ill, worried, or unhappy.

example.ex: She looked drawn and tired when she turned towards me.
example.tran: 她转向我时看上去憔悴又疲惫。

means.word_mean: 1. showing the wearing effects of overwork or care or suffering;

sentences.sentence: "looking careworn as she bent over her mending"
"her face was drawn and haggard from sleeplessness"
"shocked to see the worn look of his handsome young face"- Charles Dickens

means.word_mean: 2. subjected to great tension; stretched tight;

sentences.sentence: "the skin of his face looked drawn and tight"
"her nerves were taut as the strings of a bow"

means.word_mean: 4. having the curtains or draperies closed or pulled shut;

sentences.sentence: "the drawn draperies kept direct sunlight from fading the rug"

means.word_mean: 5. used of vehicles pulled forward (often used in combination);
